page.title: 19Organic Farming, Wray
page.content: Mr Everett came to school to talk about his organic farm at Backsbottom. On his farm, he does not use chemicals because the chemicals get into the ground and into the streams, and can kill insects, birds and animals. Pesticides can get into food and you eat them without knowing. Instead of weed-killer, he uses a hoe. He grows potatoes, peas, beans and all sorts of vegetables, and uses manure to help them grow. Mr Everett plans to build a study centre where people will be able to learn about organic farming. The centre will be solar heated, and electricity will come from a windmill and dam. Mr Everett spent three years setting up his farm, and has actually been farming for two years.
